title: Sr. Tester (Remote from anywhere in CO).
description:
Department Information




Together, we innovate for a stronger Colorado




The work of employees at the Governor's Office of Information Technology (OIT) is challenging and diverse because the needs of agencies, customers and Coloradans constantly evolve. But our focus never changes: improve the lives of all Coloradans through innovation and collaboration. We're building one of the nation's leading government IT organizations by reimagining how we support agencies, building first-of-their-kind applications, and creating an inclusive, collaborative culture, together. Join us in the important work of providing equitable access to services.




We believe equity, diversity, and inclusion drive our success, and encourage candidates from all identities, backgrounds, and abilities to apply. We know it's important to support each other, and that means having a healthy balance of work and personal time, and benefits that allow us all to have fulfilling lives.




Watch this video to learn about how OIT is thinking differently!




Description of Job




Do you want to make our beautiful state even better? At OIT, we provide secure digital services that put Coloradans first. The Sr. Tester supports that mission by contributing to the day-to-day operations of an applications testing team. If using your creativity and innovation in the testing, development and delivery of software solutions is what you love, apply today for the chance to also put your passion into the state you love.




In This Role, You Will




Identify and document test data requirements.
Create and maintain requirements traceability matrices.
Coordinate with Project Managers and Business Analysts throughout the testing process to ensure correct test and defect status is relayed.
Provide guidance when testers need one on one automation support, and be an evangelist for automation.
Maintain knowledge of version control as it relates to ALM / UFT.
Know and understand what types of automation are useful for different stages of development.
Minimum Qualifications, Substitutions, Conditions of Employment & Appeal Rights




A wide salary range is posted for this position and any job offer is based upon a salary analysis to comply with the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act. The salary analysis considers relevant experience, education, certifications, and state seniority as compared to others doing substantially similar work. While all offers are compliant with the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, there is no guarantee an offer will be at the top of the posted range based on the salary analysis.




This is a Skills-based Job Announcement. The required minimum qualifications and/or




education (if substituting for the proven experience, knowledge, and skills), are as follows:




Minimum Qualifications




3 years of professional experience as a software tester, or quality assurance engineer using multiple testing tools and methods, or 3 years experience as a software developer.
3 years minimum experience with HP ALM / UFT tool required.




Substitutions




Additional appropriate education will substitute for the required experience on a year-for-year basis, but cannot completely substitute for these qualifications.




Training or Certification related to the work assigned to the position will be assigned credit towards substitution for experience and/or education, but cannot completely substitute for these qualifications.




If the minimum qualifications include a degree requirement, additional appropriate paid or unpaid experience will substitute for the required education on a year-for-year basis.




Preferred Qualifications




Experience using data driven automation.
Willingness to learn Load and Performance testing using LoadRunner.
Proven ability to work with users and business analysts to understand and construct complex workflow automation that may encompass many pathways and modules through the application..
Ability to multitask on multiple computers or VMs while accomplishing other tasks.
Experience in combining automation tests in UFT into ALM suites.
Expert level experience in QA methodologies and practices with an emphasis on Agile and DevOps
Ability to explain and demonstrate the differences between black box, white box and gray box testing.
Ability to explain and demonstrate key concepts of continuous software improvement
Experience with Jenkins or other CI build tools
ASTQB-CTFL certifications
Hands-on technical testing experience with at least one API or unit test automation framework (jUnit, HTTPUnit, nUnit or mocking frameworks such as jMockit or easyMock).
Hands-on experience developing scripted automated tests using UI automation tools such as UFT, or Katalon and implementing those tests in a CI process using Jenkins or other CI tools.
Strong understanding of SQL, HTML, CSS and XML.
Experience as a test lead or automated test engineer.
Experience using debugging proxy tools such as Postman.
Experience testing applications utilizing Mulesoft, Salesforce, or G-Suite.
Proficiency with standard office software (Microsoft Word/Excel/Powerpoint or Google Docs/Sheets/Slides).
Experience with TRAILS or other juvenile systems.




Conditions Of Employment




OIT employees must comply with any screening procedures in place at state entity locations where they might be required to perform work.




A pre-employment background check will be conducted as part of the selection process.




Positions supporting some agencies such as the Department of Corrections and the Department of Public Safety will also require a pre-employment drug test.




This position may require travel within the specified geographic area, and to locations across the state as needed.




This position may require on-call duties as needed by the position.

title: Senior Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
Senior Quality Assurance Engineer - Automation




Who We Are




We are a small deep tech startup with specialized capacities in behavior change solutions, offering a proven combination of behavioral psychology, data analytics, and digital communications. Our company focuses effectively on creating science-based solutions that tend to embrace social purpose and enhance the quality of people’s lives by creating a variety of products that use cutting-edge machine learning and data science methods to model, segment, and create the products.




Responsibilities
Participate in developing and building an automated testing system for a machine learning platform:
Evolve QA objectives and strategies
Propose and evaluate tools and methods
Design and implement system components
Verify system functionality:
Business requirements
Architecture requirements
Verify system performance objectives:
Design and implement performance tests that verify end-to-end performance
Evaluate performance test results and communicate to the team
Verify security objectives:
Design and implement security tests
Evaluate security test findings and communicate to the team
Evaluate machine learning models to assess the quality of the resulting data
Identify testing targets within system architectures
Write test drivers in Python to:
inject test data into systems under test
read and evaluate test results
measure system performance
Test for failure modes and verify that the system properly recovers
Create and maintain test case scripts within the test management system
Design testing strategies that solve difficult testing problems.
Monitor automated test runs
Communicate potential defects and anomalies to the development team:
Clearly state the problem and the expected result
Assign an objective severity to the defect
Participate in code reviews
Participate in evolving the agile development process
Be a key voice to approve deployments to production




Qualifications




Bachelors degree in computer science, data science, engineering or related fields
Experience as a Senior QA Analyst, Automation Engineer or equivalent
Experience with automated testing environments and testing tools – Selenium, UFT One, Katalon, etc...
Proficient in one or more programming languages, Python (preferred), Java, JavaScript, C#, Angular, etc…
Relational database experience, SQL language (required)
NoSQL database experience preferred – DynamoDB, MongoDB, etc...
Experience with web technologies – HTML, CSS, JSON, Rest APIs
Participation on an agile team (scrum or kanban)
Experience with machine learning platforms highly desired
Familiar with web and machine learning architectures
Experience with performance testing
Experience with security testing




Salary: $105000 - $130000/yr plus bonus and equity

title: UAT Test Manager
description:
Hello,




This is Tejaswini from Software Technologies Inc. We have a job opening with our client for position of UAT Test Manager if you are available and looking for any new opportunities, please send me your updated resume for below position ASAP.




Job Title: UAT Test Manager




Only Local Consultants




Location: Boise, Idaho 83805 ONSITE AS NEEDED - REQUIRED




Description




The Idaho Department of Health and Welfare, Welfare Division, has a need for a Test Manager to support the advancement of the testing function. The Role of Test Manager is to effectively lead the business testing team.




POSITION REQUIRES SOME ONSITE WORK - Remote work is allowed, but the person needs to be able to be ONSITE in the Boise office AS NEEDED BY CLIENT to attend required meetings, discoveries, planning, etc. Travel costs for onsite work will not be covered by the client or CAI, so local candidates will be the best fit for this position.




The Idaho Department of Health and Welfare, Welfare Division, has a need for a Test Manager to support multiple initiatives including Child Support and Benefits modernization. The Role of Test Manager is to effectively lead the business testing team. To fulfill this role the Test Manager must understand the discipline of testing and how to effectively implement a testing process while fulfilling the traditional team leadership role. This involves creating a test infrastructure that supports robust communication and a cost-effective testing framework.




A successful UAT Test Manager is more focused on the larger systems at play than the scenarios being tested. They ensure testers have considered multiple facets of testing and are responsible for identifying if shippable increments are \"ready\" for release from an automation perspective. The selected candidate will be mission oriented and self-starting.




Detailed Description: Immediate responsibilities will include maintaining an effective testing process and making improvements to this process, including additional automation, to increase the overall effectiveness of the testing function. This position will provide test definition, execution and management for the suite of the Welfare Division systems that support, but not limited to, Medicaid, Aid to the Aged Blind and Disabled (AABD) cash, Temporary Assistance to Families in Idaho (Idaho's TANF funded TAFI program), SNAP (Food Stamps), the Idaho Child Care Program, and Child Support. The Division of Welfare uses the Scrum Agile development methodology, so all methods and strategies should be consistent with this. The Test Manager will also bring consolidation to the various automated load and regression testing tools that have been implemented. In this role, the Test Manager will work closely with automation teams and business partners to ensure User Acceptance Test (UAT), Integrated Testing, and Partner Testing are successful.




The test manager will also be responsible for the following:

Release management experience.

Test Strategy: provides the overall approach to testing including team members, tools and processes
Test Plan: presents the test: objectives, scope, approach, assumptions, dependencies, risks and schedule for a particular release
Test Cases: specific tests defined to ensure business requirements are met and capture defects when not met
Defect Documentation: generation of defects captured during test phase
Defect Tracking: tracking, management, and reporting of found defects
Measurements and Metrics: effective and useful measures of the testing process
Status Reports: provides progress toward testing objectives
Automated Tests: provide automated load and regression tests
Manual User Acceptance Tests: Define process, scenarios, and test plan for manual business user acceptance testing
Test Team Member Roles: definition of test team member roles

Thanks,

N.TEJASWINI NAIDU

Technical recruiter

Direct:404-777-9838 | Fax: 866-608-6686

Email: tejaswini.n@stiorg.com | Web: www.stiorg.com

100 Overlook Center, Suite 200

Princeton, NJ 08540.

title: Test Data Management (TDM) Lead - Healthcare Insurance Domain - REMOTE
description:
Req ID: 247501




NTT DATA Services strives to hire exceptional, innovative and passionate individuals who want to grow with us. If you want to be part of an inclusive, adaptable, and forward-thinking organization, apply now.




We are currently seeking a Test Data Management (TDM) Lead - Healthcare Insurance Domain - REMOTE to join our team in Plano, Texas (US-TX), United States (US).




Day to Day Responsibilities Include:
As a TDM Architect, Involved in engagement with stakeholders from different application teams to understand and document the current application landscape, their architecture and interfaces, databases, test sets and data dependencies.
Develop detailed roadmap and strategy to define and meet objectives of Client TDM goals.
Developing and supporting tools/scripts for Test data, and implementing TDM processes and solutions using Delphix and Synthetic Data tools.
Synthetic tool evaluation and present to client
Creating consistent and repeatable processes to support multiple functions, such as
Identifying and masking test data for different applications,
Refreshing/updating test data
Mine existing data and/or synthetic data generation as needed.
Ensuring compliance with IT security guidelines and data compliance regulations
Provisioning data for QA testing, user acceptance testing, and performance testing.
Integration of Data De-Identification & Synthetic Data tool into application pipelines
Coordinate with offshore team and client stakeholders and ensure all deliverables are delivered on time and with quality.




Minimum Requirements




12+ years of progressive IT experience in Testing
4+ years of experience in Health Plan domain with good understanding of healthcare payor processes - Enrollment, Claims, Provider and Authorization.
8+ years of experience in Test Data Management
4+ years of Delphix - Data Virtualization & Masking and any synthetic Data tool
4+ years Oracle, SQL Server, DB2, PostgreSQL and MySQL
3+ years as a Lead
Bachelors Degree




Desired Skills :




Preferred Genrocket synthetic tool to create and mine test data, as well as the ability to automate data generation to test scenarios rapidly.
Solid understanding of data governance, data quality and metadata management.
Experience with Agile methodologies and DevOps practices and understanding on usage of ADO and Service Now




INDHCLSMC




NOTE: Candidates must be located in EST and CST Time Zones to be considered due to work schedule.




Where required by law, NTT DATA provides a reasonable range of compensation for specific roles. The starting pay range for this remote role is $90,800 – 210,400. This range reflects the minimum and maximum target compensation for the position across all US locations. Actual compensation will depend on a number of factors, including the candidate’s actual work location, relevant experience, technical skills, and other qualifications. This position may also be eligible for incentive compensation based on individual and/or company performance.




About NTT DATA Services




NTT DATA Services is a recognized leader in IT and business services, including cloud, data and applications, headquartered in Texas. As part of NTT DATA, a $30 billion trusted global innovator with a combined global reach of over 80 countries, we help clients transform through business and technology consulting, industry and digital solutions, applications development and management, managed edge-to-cloud infrastructure services, BPO, systems integration and global data centers. We are committed to our clients’ long-term success. Visit nttdata.com or LinkedIn to learn more.




NTT DATA Services is an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants without regarding to race, color, religion, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment for all employees. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter so that we may connect you with the appropriate team.

title: Sr Customer Communications Testing Engineer - Work From Home
description:
About Lumen




Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies.




The Role




Provides expert technical direction at a feature level. This role will be responsible for planning, developing, and executing tests for complex systems and equipment. The individual will collaborate with various teams across IT to identify the impacts of test requirements and improve the overall quality of the final deliverables. As a testing expert, this person will possess strong communication skills and will be expected to partner with business, IT Development and testing groups to anticipate the effects of testing and bring timely resolution to critical issues. Within their area of expertise, to include testing of Marketing Cloud and Contact Engine journeys, this person will provide specialized advice and direction. They will contribute towards the team’s continual process improvement and will also provide industry knowledge regarding test strategy development, test R&D activities, and technical support when applicable. The position is part of the Salesforce & Marketing Cloud configuration team and is responsible for Contact Engine, Service Now, Salesforce & Marketing Cloud testing and test design.




The Main Responsibilities




Develop test cases and expected results to test all aspects of digital communications.
Perform QA coordination in conjunction with the QA team.
Perform manual testing of web, mobile & desktop applications that trigger email, sms and push notifications.
Implement QA metrics, including benchmarking and identification of areas for improving overall performance.
Perform unit testing for new digital communications features implemented.
Test, demonstrate, and support Salesforce system configuration solutions – reporting, workflows, custom objects and fields, data-extensions, automations, dynamic content scripting and templates to support complex communication journeys using email, SMS, mobile push, direct mail and robo-calls.
Responsible for developing and enforcing key capabilities and standards related to: lead management, preference management, contact identity, naming conventions, GDPR, CCPA, and CITA best practices.
Participate in the solution design process including developing test cases prior to the initiation of development.
Production support for existing solutions as well as maintaining and troubleshooting active solutions.
Partner with project teams to design and implement solutions with Salesforce Connector and data models with Sales/Service Cloud.




Job Duties




5% Perform QA planning
5% Participate in the solution design
30% Develop test cases and expected results
50% Perform manual or build automated testing
10% Production support




Required




What We Look For in a Candidate




Bachelor’s degree or equivalent education and related experience
2+ years related experience (1+ years with a master’s degree)
2+ years Salesforce testing experience with preference to developer skills
1+ years Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Service Cloud or Contact Engine test experience
Experience working with internal business partners and outside consultants
Experience testing solutions using agile methodologies and processes
1+ years of exposure to integrations, testing and executing data migrations (SOAP APIs, REST APIs and integration techniques).
Hands-on experience understanding Content Builder, Journey Builder, MobileConnect, Automation Studio, Contact Builder (Data Designer)
Experience understanding HTML and CSS (specifically for Emails)
Experience understanding scripting languages and protocols such as SQL, AMPScript, SSJS, JavaScript, XML, JSON
Experience with at least 1 full-scale SFMC, SC or Contact engine project
Strong knowledge and experience with integrating MC or CE to back end systems
Transactional email and sms messaging best practices
Experience testing complex email automations




Preferred




Salesforce Certified Marketing Cloud Developer
Salesforce Certified Marketing Cloud Consultant
Salesforce Certified Marketing Cloud Email Specialist
Experience with enterprise orchestration and transformation tools, like MuleSoft and Talend
Experience with multiple Salesforce instances and Marketing Cloud or Contact Engine business units
Experience leading solution testing via Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) processes
Experience with enterprise agile project management tools such as JIRA and Confluence




What To Expect Next




Requisition #: 329177




When applying for a position, you may be subject to a background screen (criminal records check, motor vehicle report, and/or drug screen), depending on the requirements for the position. More information on what’s included in these checks can be found in the Post Offer section of our FAQ page. Job-related concerns noted in the background screen may disqualify you from the new position or your current role. Background results will be evaluated on a case-by-case basis.




EEO Statement




We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all persons regardless of race, color, ancestry, citizenship, national origin, religion, veteran status, disability, genetic characteristic or information, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, family status, pregnancy, or other legally protected status (collectively, “protected statuses”). We do not tolerate unlawful discrimination in any employment decisions, including recruiting, hiring, compensation, promotion, benefits, discipline, termination, job assignments or training.




NOTE: Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.




Disclaimer




The above job definition information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. Job duties and responsibilities are subject to change based on changing business needs and conditions.




Salary Range




Salary Min




72540




Salary Max




161520




This information reflects the anticipated base salary range for this position based on current national data. Minimums and maximums may vary based on location. Individual pay is based on skills, experience and other relevant factors.




This position is eligible for either short-term incentives or sales compensation. Director and VP positions also are eligible for long-term incentive. To learn more about our bonus structure, you can view additional information here. We're able to answer any additional questions you may have as you move through the selection process.




As part of our comprehensive benefits package, Lumen offers a broad range of Health, Life, Voluntary Lifestyle and other benefits and perks that enhance your physical, mental, emotional and financial wellbeing. You can learn more by clicking here.

title: Workday Integration Test Lead [REMOTE]
description:
Position: Workday Integration Test Lead [REMOTE]




Location: San Diego, CA




Duration: 12+ Months Contract




Total Hours/week: 40.00




1st Shift




Client: Medical Device Company




Employment Type: Contract on W2 (Need US Citizens Or GC Holders Only)




No H1B’s




Work hours: As needed, generally 8-5 eastern time zone. May flex for meetings with other regions, countries.

Remote

3 Must haves on the resume: Workday Test Lead during an implementation, Project management experience, Integration test scenario development and strategy experience

The Berra Workday Integration Test Lead will be responsible for creating test scenarios for the Systems, Integration, User Acceptance (UAT) and End to End (E2E) testing phases of the Human Resources Workday implementation for the Diabetes Care spinoff from BD. This would include designing testing templates, creating test scenarios from business requirements and process documentation, identifying test criteria for data extraction, extracting specific test ids to meet testing criteria (UAT and E2E only), communicating test scenarios and obtaining input from testers, assistance with training testers, and assisting with execution of test scenarios including identification of defects and documenting test results. Will be providing assistance and input into the development, management, and execution of the test plan to ensure completion of all tasks within the scheduled amount of time, as well as ensuring that all business requirements have been thoroughly tested and all design meets the expectation of the requester as required. This position also requires a strong focus on task management, flexibility, and adjusting test activities to ensure quality.

Duties And Responsibilities

Review and comprehend all project documents to be able to determine test script creation activities
Review and approve all test scenarios developed by test scenario writers, as well as completing test scenario development as needed
Design testing templates for end users
Create scenarios with expected results that track back to each business requirements
Attend all project meetings to gain knowledge of the project and ask appropriate test questions.
Develop test id criteria for data extraction
Assist with data extractions
Assist with developing communications/presentations for training end users
Assist with end user training sessions including follow-up on outstanding issues as requested
Assist with executing functional UAT, BST and SIT/integration and regression testing as requested
Assistance with analysis and reporting of test results in a clear and timely manner according to business requirements as requested
Assist with accurate tracking and monitoring of testing failures and related defect tracking as requested
Closely work with the project team, communicating issues and reporting testing progress as requested
Escalating issues in a timely manner
Demonstrates working knowledge of concepts and principles of the testing methodology
Ensure that all testing scenarios have been formally captured and stored on the appropriate SharePoint/Teams site or QA system

Education/Experience/Skills Requirements

Bachelor of science degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Business Administration, Human Resources or related field
Three to Five (3-5) years’ experience on multiple HR projects writing test scenarios
Experience with Workday testing highly favorable
One (1) years’ experience specifically related to Workday HCM projects as a test script/scenario writer preferred
One (1) year of management experience managing test scenario writers or test team preferred
Demonstrated ability to work independently, remaining agile and flexible in a challenging environment and managing multiple competing priorities.
Possesses excellent demonstrated written and verbal communication skills
Command of various testing methodologies and tools
Proficiency in MS Office suite including Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, Word, SharePoint, Teams and Visio required

title: UAT Test Manager with Min 5+yrs exp in creating test models for product test and release control (Webcam Interview)(HYBRID)
description:
Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Advanced American Technologies, Inc, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!




Client is looking for UAT Test Manager (Min 5+ yrs exp) (Webcam Interview)




Position Description




DIRECT CLIENT Position




Number of positions: 1




Length: 12 Months +




Work Address: Boise, Idaho 83805




Immediate interviews- Webcam Interview




This position is HYBRID. Remote work is allowed, but SOME ONSITE WORK WILL BE REQUIRED as the selected resource needs to be able to be in the office AS NEEDED BY CLIENT




Need for a Test Manager to support the advancement of the testing function. The Role of Test Manager is to effectively lead the business testing team.




POSITION REQUIRES SOME ONSITE WORK - Remote work is allowed, but the person needs to be able to be ONSITE in the Boise office AS NEEDED BY CLIENT to attend required meetings, discoveries, planning, etc. Travel costs for onsite work will not be covered by the client or CAI, so local candidates will be the best fit for this position.




Need for a Test Manager to support multiple initiatives including Child Support and Benefits modernization. The Role of Test Manager is to effectively lead the business testing team. To fulfill this role the Test Manager must understand the discipline of testing and how to effectively implement a testing process while fulfilling the traditional team leadership role. This involves creating a test infrastructure that supports robust communication and a cost-effective testing framework.




A successful UAT Test Manager is more focused on the larger systems at play than the scenarios being tested. They ensure testers have considered multiple facets of testing and are responsible for identifying if shippable increments are \"ready\" for release from an automation perspective. The selected candidate will be mission oriented and self-starting.




Detailed Description: Immediate responsibilities will include maintaining an effective testing process and making improvements to this process, including additional automation, to increase the overall effectiveness of the testing function. The Division of Welfare uses the Scrum Agile development methodology, so all methods and strategies should be consistent with this. The Test Manager will also bring consolidation to the various automated load and regression testing tools that have been implemented. In this role, the Test Manager will work closely with automation teams and business partners to ensure User Acceptance Test (UAT), Integrated Testing, and Partner Testing are successful.




The test manager will also be responsible for the following:




Release management experience.




Test Strategy: provides the overall approach to testing including team members, tools and processes
Test Plan: presents the test: objectives, scope, approach, assumptions, dependencies, risks and schedule for a particular release
Test Cases: specific tests defined to ensure business requirements are met and capture defects when not met
Defect Documentation: generation of defects captured during test phase
Defect Tracking: tracking, management, and reporting of found defects
Measurements and Metrics: effective and useful measures of the testing process
Status Reports: provides progress toward testing objectives
Automated Tests: provide automated load and regression tests
Manual User Acceptance Tests: Define process, scenarios, and test plan for manual business user acceptance testing
Test Team Member Roles: definition of test team member roles




Required/Desired Skills




Candidates must have ALL the "Required" skills in order to be considered for the position. "Desired" or "Highly Desired" skills are a PLUS but may NOT be required.




Skill Matrix




Experience with Business workflow processes




Required / Desired




Amount




Of Experience




Demonstrated ability to communicate to many different types of stakeholders in high stress situations, especially in virtual environments.




Required




5




Years




Experience creating test models for product test and release control (plans, data, and scripts).




Required




3




Years




Experience coordinating and performing automated testing using various tools to augment manual testing




Required

Experience participating in iterative projects, with responsibilities such as taking notes, tracking project status, impediments, or issue resolutions




Required

Experience documenting and tracking defects during a testing phase of application development.




Required

Release management experience




Required




3

Experience with Division of Welfare applications such as IBES, Nexi, Mia, eVerif-I.




Highly desired

Experience working with state agencies to gain good knowledge of benefit or child support programs.

FamilySearch Software Dev Engineer 3 (5-Year Fixed-Term, US-based, Remote Optional)
description:
Job Description




The Software Development Engineer 3 is an experienced professional, full-stack engineer who works independently on tasks and assignments from a Software Development Manager, a project technical lead, or the team. This position utilizes solid knowledge, skills, and abilities with technology and programming languages to analyze, design, program, debug, test, modify, and write documentation and procedures for installation and maintenance of organization technology-related products, Internet applications, or information support systems.




As a member of the broader software development group, the Software Development Engineer 3 works with minimal supervision and direction and is expected to utilize their experience, full understanding of industry practices, and knowledge of Church policies and procedures to exercise judgment in selecting methods and techniques for solving problems of a diverse scope. This position may also serve as the technical lead for a small team, a small to medium functional area, or for a short-term project.




This individual works with divine guidance to provide or support technology that furthers the mission of the Church and reflects the eternal impact of the gospel.




Responsibilities




Implement plan to support team-wide development strategy
Contribute to and perform analysis of functional requirements
Act as a technical lead when the technical lead is unavailable; mentor less-senior developers
Create technical designs mapped to functional requirements
Provide estimates for development tasks
Develop source code and unit tests according to technical designs
Participate in code reviews
Support requirements and design driven processes by partnering with User Experience Professionals.
Contribute to technical documentation
Participate in the Problem Management process and fix issues
Implement measures, as designed, to comply with policies, standards, and regulatory requirements and ensure all others are doing the same




Required




Qualifications




Education




Bachelor's degree in related field or equivalent experience




Work Experience




4+ years of progressive and relevant professional experience




Demonstrated Skills & Abilities




Strong understanding of Agile Software Development methodologies and principles
Solid base of learning and some experience in all the primary areas of an n-tier enterprise system that may or may not be web based (e.g., interface domain logic and database layers)
Great verbal and written communication skills
Strong full-stack skills in engineering troubleshooting, web technology, user interfaces, and/or programming methodology
Solid understanding of systems and subsystems
Familiarity with Cloud Based Platforms and services
Strong understanding of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery principles.
Demonstrated knowledge of applicable software, computer languages, and code to perform the responsibilities of the role
Demonstrated aptitude and willingness to learn new technologies and programming languages
This job operates in a professional home or hybrid environment
To successfully perform the essential functions of the job there may be physical requirements which need to be met such as sitting for long periods of time and using computer monitors/equipment




Preferred Qualifications




Experience with complex, large-scale systems including strong experience in the tools, methodologies, and technologies the role supports




About Us




Church employees find joy and satisfaction in using their unique talents and abilities to further the Lord’s work. From the IT professional who develops an app that sends the gospel message worldwide, to the facilities manager who maintains our buildings— giving Church members places to worship, teach, learn, and receive sacred ordinances—our employees seek innovative ways to share the gospel of Jesus Christ with the world. They are literally working in His kingdom.




Only members of the Church who are worthy of a temple recommend qualify for employment. Apart from this, the Church is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in its employment decisions on any basis that would violate U.S. or local law.




Qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, national origin, color, gender, pregnancy, marital status, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or other legally protected categories that apply to the Church. The Church will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities.

title: Senior Integrations Specialist (Remote)
description:
At Truckstop, we have transformed the entire freight-moving lifecycle with our SaaS solutions.  From freight matching to payments and everything in between, we are the trusted partner for carriers, brokers, and shippers alike. 

We lead this industry forward with our One Team mindset committing to principles such as assume positive intent, have each other’s back, and be your authentic self.  Our drive for greatness produces high expectations, yet our regard for humans is even higher.

Join a team of brilliant minds and generous hearts who care deeply about other's success.

Position Summary:

The Sr. Integrations Specialist plays a key role in providing daily advanced technical support to our external and internal partners. Support requests range from less-complex to very-complex. The Integrations Specialist will be the technical lead throughout the integration projects lifecycle, from concept to post-deployment. The Integrations Specialist will work with partners to resolve technical issues while providing world-class customer service. You will also have the opportunity to partner with members of the engineering, product management, customer support, and marketing teams.

Essential job Functions:

Lead daily technical support request from external and internal partners/customers
Technical lead for integration projects (i.e. leads technical discussions with partners, lead demos, and address support requests)
Troubleshoot and resolve partner’s escalations in a timely manner
Manage defects reported by partners through the complete lifecycle (capturing defect to verification).
Manage partner’s escalations and channel them accordingly (i.e. escalating cases that need fix from the development team)
Drive continuous improvement for the integrations support processes by working closely with the Integration Operations Manager.
Report support status and escalation in a timely manner to the Integration Operations Manager.
Lead client provisioning activities (i.e. setting up account and granting correct permissions)
Set up partner test environment and management using SQL queries and scripts
Create and maintain technical support documentation by working closely with the Integrations Technical Content Engineer and Integrations Operations Manager.
Perform data analysis on company’s web-services/APIs on as-needed basis


Position Requirements:

Bachelor or Master of Science degree in Computer Science, Electrical and/or Computer
Five+ years of experience in Technical Customer/Partner Support
Strong experience in working with web services and APIs
Mastery of relational databases and SQL queries.
Ability to quickly understand database schema and write JOIN queries to pull data from multiple tables
Ability to properly document and create customer support content
Creative analytical and problem-solving skills to deliver high customer satisfaction
Ability to manage multiple priorities within a fast paced and high-volume environment
Excellent verbal and written communication skills to inspire confidence while leading partners/customers through the steps to resolve issues via phone and email.
Advanced multi-tasking skills
Must be able to work with minimal supervision and search for answers by himself/herself
Extremely organized, detail oriented, pro-active, self-starter, self-learner, and not afraid of asking questions.
Preferred: Experience working on Service Cloud workflows, Talend, Mulesfot, Informatica, C#, VB. Knowledge of scripting using Java, Ruby, or Perl is a plus


The above description covers the most significant duties performed but does not include other related occasional work that may be assigned or is completed by the employee.

Truckstop provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Quality Assurance (QA) Test Lead (Remote)
description:
DPP is seeking a Quality Assurance (QA) Test Lead for an opportunity in Des Moines, Iowa.




Position Description




The QA Test Lead will be tasked with overseeing the testing performed in the Agile Scrum Teams to ensure the delivery of the highest quality releases.
The QA Lead will also provide metrics on the overall testing progress.
Work arrangement:




This position is currently remote; however, it is possible the organization will could return to an on-site position in the future.
W2 position.
Responsibilities:




Review and oversee all manual testing efforts performed by System Integrator and state Resources.
Participate in story reviews including end to end.
Attend Non-Functional Story Reviews and approve testing scenarios.
Provide weekly testing and defect metrics to give Leadership a status of the progress of the development efforts for each release stream.
Participate in Defect Management Process
Offer potential testing process improvements and provide Testers with guidance on best practices.
Assist with any manual regression testing.
Participate in the process of determining which manual test cases will be included in automated regression testing.
Required knowledge, skills, and abilities:




Experience developing test plans and test cases (10 years)
Thorough knowledge of manual and automated testing
Experience testing Web Applications
Experience developing and executing API test cases
Working knowledge of Windows and Unix Platforms
Extensive knowledge of testing principles and defect management systems and processes
Demonstrated ability to transform business scenarios into manual and automated test coverage
Fundamental understanding of SQL database concepts
Demonstrated ability to effectively use third party tools and system utilities
Ability to work well in a project team
Excellent written and oral communications skills
Experience working with an Agile Development Process
Knowledge and experience deploying risk-based testing techniques
Experience with performance, load, stress, and endurance testing
Knowledge of Medicaid Applications and CMS Regulations (5 years)
Knowledge of Financial and Food Assistance Programs (desired)
Interested? Learn more:




Click the apply button or contact our recruiter Kenny at Kenny.Jarema@dppit.com to learn more about this position (#23-00484).




DPP offers a range of compensation and benefits packages to our employees and their eligible dependents. Call today to learn more about working with DPP.




Authorized US Worker - US Citizens and those authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor at this time. EOE/AA/V/D

title: QA Testing Engineer | (iOS and Android) | Remote
description:
Job Description




Primary Skills - Automated QA Testing




Description




The QA Engineer will be responsible for designing, developing, running, maintaining and documenting all types of test cases and testing strategies for iOS and Android apps.
This includes functional testing, performance testing, maintaining existing automation scripts, and adding new automation scripts.
This person will participate in the functional testing of the features as they were developed by team members, create bug tickets for any issues identified, develop automation scripts for new functionality.
Works closely with Developers, Designers and Product owners to delivery high quality software.




Essential Duties And Responsibilities




Lead testing efforts against our code feature on iOS and Android applications.
Develop, and run test cases and test strategy for new features.
Provide updates to the current automation repository.
Attend all scrum meetings and project specific meetings.
Troubleshoot any production issues as needed
Take lead on running pre-regression test cases for our bi-weekly releases.
Attention to details for UI changes.
Think out of the box to uncover issues during the development phase minimizing customer facing issues.




Professional Competencies




Good knowledge on using Xcode and Android Studio for testing.
Experience using testing tools (like Charles Proxy, Postman, Firebase, Jira) and Test management tools (like TestRail)
Strong understanding of data driven applications.
Experience in working within Agile/Scrum teams.
Good analytical and communication skills.




Required Skills




At least 3 years of mobile apps testing experience.
Strong passion for quality.
Experience in QA Automation SDKs like Appium.
Experience in the retail industry is a plus.
